final leg motif ending the leg s colourwork chart on round 43 i chose to do this because i am significantly shorter than average and so prefer a slightly shorter leg to my socks this is the only difference between the sample and the pattern construction overview the socks are knit cuff-down and use the forethought heel method first stitches are cast on and joined in the round the cuff is then knit in 2x2 rib next the leg s colourwork chart is knit before scrap yarn is used to place the forethought heel subsequently the foot s colourwork chart is knit and then the toe there are two toe shaping options the first is a classic wedge toe which is worked the same across both socks and the second is a left and right toe which differs for each sock finally stitches are picked up around the heel placement and the heel is knit in the round yarn recommendations the recommended yarn for the turner socks is west yorkshire spinners signature 4-ply 400 m / 437 yds per 100g however any standard fingering-weight sock yarn can be used the sample uses west yorkshire spinners signature 4-ply in the shade pennyroyal for the mc and the shade marshmallow as the cc you will need approximately 126 160 194 228 262 297 m / 138 175 212 249 286 325 yds of your mc and 84 88 92 97 101 105 m / 92 96 100 106 110 114 yds of your cc choosing a size the tuner socks should be worn with around 1 25 cm / 1/ of negative ease to choose a size measure the 2 circumference of your foot at the widest point and choose a size which will give you the appropriate amount of negative ease for example if your foot circumference measured 20 25 cm / 8 you would knit a size 3 which will give you 1 25 cm / 1/ of negative ease 2 gauge the gauge for the turner socks is 35 stitches x 44 row per 10 cm / 4 needles and notions 2 5 mm us 1 5 needle for casting on optional 2 25 mm us 1 needle for working the socks or whatever size needle allows you to meet gauge bor marker plus one additional removable marker such
